# updateChangeCount(_:)

**Instance Method**

Updates the change counter by indicating the kind of change.

## Declaration

```swift
func updateChangeCount(_ change: UIDocument.ChangeKind)
```

## Parameters

- **change**: A constant that indicates whether a change has been made, cleared, undone, or redone. See [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIDocument/ChangeKind] for more information.

## Discussion

Calling this method can affect the value returned by [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIDocument/hasUnsavedChanges]. You shouldn’t need to call method this if you access an [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Foundation/UndoManager] object from the [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIDocument/undoManager] property (or assign a custom one to it) and register changes with the undo manager.

## Tracking changes and autosaving

- **hasUnsavedChanges**: A Boolean value that indicates whether the document has any unsaved changes.
- **undoManager**: The undo manager for the document.
- **changeCountToken(for:)**: Returns a change token for a specific save operation.
- **updateChangeCount(withToken:for:)**: Updates the change count with reference to a change-count token passed in by UIKit.
- **autosave(completionHandler:)**: Initiates automatic saving of documents with unsaved changes.
